column1: Based off the conjugation tables at: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/olmak#Turkish
This file describes conjugation of basic verbs (without causative, passive, etc suffixes) using the example of "ol-".
Every line from the tables in that article corresponds to a line in this file.
Additionally, I've added some morpheme segmentation, and for some of the lines, have added
(1) the suffix chains used in this line,
The following MORPHEME SLOTS can be deduced from the forms here:
- TAM1 where TAM stands for Tense/Aspect/Mood
- 3rd Pl -lar-: a suffix used in all 3rd person plural forms
- TAM2: a second slot for TAM markers that follow the 3rd person plural marker

- Subject Agreement: this is empty in the 3rd person, and is occupied by some suffix otherwise. One could also think about decomposing this into Person+Number, which makes a lot of sense for the second person (singular -sun, plural -sun-uz), though a bit less for the first person (singular -um, plural -uz).
Here mu- is an auxiliary that seems to be inflected like a POSITIVE DECLARATIVE verb.
In many of these forms, the main stem is not inflected for person, except for the 3rd Person Plural suffix -lar-, which seems to be always present.
